intro: Dicrastylis costelloi var. violacea, commonly known as the violet-flowered flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered violet flowers. It typically grows in wet or seasonally waterlogged soils, often in swampy or marshy areas. This variety is distinguished by its striking violet flower color, which sets it apart from other members of the Dicrastylis genus.
